ygData.subject: Re: DoT/DD/Hymn equations
ygData.msgSnippet: Well I haven t done much kiting as my first attempt at level 17 in N.Karana was a disaster.  I was grouped with a level 19 Wizard and we were just North of the
ygData.messageBody:
Well I haven't done much kiting as my first attempt at level 17 in N.Karana
was a disaster. I was grouped with a level 19 Wizard and we were just North
of the W.Karana zone on the path. I was using Selo's, Bellow and CoD when I
ran too close to a house "LOADING PLEASE WAIT" I do know that griffawns
have double attack and I don't think solo kiting is really even possible
till we get Chains. It's been very painful everytime I've gotten mixed up
with a griff, although I've never died thanks to Selo's.

I'm curious about other bards success kiting with level 20 and under songs.
How do you balance running out of range for such a long kite if your only
bellowing? And if your using CoD or DDD how much success do you have
keeping from attracting other mobs and instakill NPC's?

For that matter how useful is Largo's Melodic Binding and does anyone
actually use it? Having just gotten level 20 I've started using Anthem,
Hymn, Largo's, Bellow or Denons. I mainly group because soloing pre-20 in
S.Karana gave me a lot of exercise in running to the zone :)

Lakosh ? <Divine Harmony>
Fresh level 20 Bard of Tunare

P.S. I'm trying to find a good unique surname that goes well with my name,
email me directly if you have any suggestions.

P.P.S. If you do a second P.S. it is done P.P.S. not P.S.S. P.S. stands
for postscript, so a second one is a post postscript, not a postscript
script. However if you just want to add a couple items under one P.S., then
use P.SS. which is the plural of P.S. :^)

P.P.P.S. I used to confuse/mis-use these all the time:
i.e. = id est "that is (to say)"
e.g. = exempli gratia "for example"

No, I'm not a teacher or an english major, just a picky bastard. As a
matter of fact I had to drop Freshman english because I was failing!

----- Original Message -----
From: B. Bedford <bbedford@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, November 19, 1999 4:53 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] DoT/DD/Hymn equations


> From: "B. Bedford" <bbedford@...>
>
> Cool :)
> No one knows the dmg equation for CoD? Thats actually one of the more
> important ones =) I've been kiting yellow gorge hounds at level 15 (just
> got 16) and wasn't able to tell if weaving selos/bellow/cod was better
than
> selos/bellow/bellow (using strings). Any help is appreciated...oh, anyone
> know if I would be able to kite griffawns like this? I hear they run the
> same speed as hounds, and I never actually get hit while kiting...I just
> sorta run around in a circle to the beat of my own footsteps =)
>
> Thanks again,
> Taluvil
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. <Dean_Kimes@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Friday, November 19, 1999 5:46 PM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] DoT/DD/Hymn equations
>
>
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> >
> > >With Lute (why sing it without?) it's 4hp +2 for every 6 levels of exp.
> So
> > >at 6th level it's doing 6 hp per pulse and 12th level it's 8 hp per
pulse
> > >(sitting). The weird part is that at 24th level I started doing 13 hp
> per
> > >pulse and 11 sitting down (the difference used to be just one between
> > >sitting and standing) so I that seems to blow the formula but that's
the
> > one
> > >I always heard.
> >
> > I often sing it while smacking away in combat.
> > You are confused a bit mixing in the natural regen rate here. At 12 you
> get
> > 8 pts per pulse with lute while sitting total. That's 6 from Hymn plus
2
> > natural. At 18th you get 10 per pulse sitting total, again 8 from Hymn
> plus
> > 2 natural. Your sitting regen rates increases past 2 after 20th level,
> not
> > sure exactly when but I know it goes up to 3 natural regen somewhere
soon
> on
> > or after 20th.
> > Using my formula for lute of (1hp + 1hp/6lvls)*2 means at 12 hymn should
> do
> > 6, it does; at 18th it should do 8, again it does. It does half that
much
> > without lute so you get at 12th level Hymn for 3, plus 1 natural so 4.
At
> > 18 it would be 4 plus 1 natural so 5. These both fit the actual result
so
> > the equation is correct.
> >
> > >More simply put, Hymn starts at 6 per pulse at 6th level (but you'd get
> two
> > >from just sitting without the song) and it improves 2 hp per pulse
every
> > six
> > >levels after. This is not dependent on string skill level because I
hear
> > it
> > >keeps going up even after we've maxed string.
> >
> > Same as you get with my equation, Hymn does 4pt at 6th, plus the 2 for
> > sitting = 6.
> >
> >
> > Kitasi of E'ci
> >
> > > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
> >
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
